content: यक्षः [यक्ष्यते, यक्ष्-कर्मणि घञ्] {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of a class of demigods who are described as attendants of Kubera, the god of riches, and employed in guarding his gardens and treasures; यक्षोत्तमा यक्षपतिं धनेशं रक्षंति वै प्रासगदादिहस्ताः <ls>Hariv.</ls>, <ls>Me. 1</ls>, <ls n="Me.">66</ls>; <ls>Bg. 10. 23</ls>, <ls n="Bg.">11. 22.</ls> {@--2@} A kind of ghost or spirit. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of the palace of Indra. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of Kubera. {@--5@} Worship. --क्षं {@--1@} A ghost, {@--2@} Sacrifice. {@--3@} Anything honoured. --क्षी {@--1@} A female Yakṣa. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of Kubera's wife.
